New Records: Malaysia moved to the top of the table with 10 points and a net run rate of +2.612 after their win against Mongolia.
Singapore stayed fourth with eight points and a net run rate of +3.141 after their win against Myanmar.
Malaysia's Virandeep Singh returned with figures of 4-1-5-4 in their match against Mongolia.
Singapore's Harsha Bharadwaj was the pick of their bowlers with figures of 4-2-8-4 in their match against Myanmar.
Key Match Events: Malaysia romped past the finish line in only 2.1 overs against Mongolia.
Singapore bowled their opponents out for 45 in 17.5 overs against Myanmar.
Malaysia's Virandeep Singh took four wickets and scored 31 runs in their match against Mongolia.
Post-Match Reflections: Malaysia stayed third in the table with five wins and a net run rate of +2.612 before their match against Mongolia.
Singapore stayed fourth with eight points and a net run rate of +3.141 before their match against Myanmar.
Malaysia's win moved them to the top of the table, while Mongolia remained at the bottom with six consecutive losses.
